TopicTitle: KSS DesTiny: Fully assembled, ready for burn

Articles.Content:
Been playing this game for a while. One thing I have really yet to do is do interplanetary missions. not anymore.

I built this huge prototype interplanetary ship with lander in Orbit with 9 separate launches (Not including the assembler) I think i expended over 1500 units of Mono-propellent in the assembly. It has a science lab, 3 Hitchhickers, and it's current lander (with two rovers) is capable of Landing and returning to orbit from Moho. It tips the scales at 380 Tons, 680 parts, 240 struts, and has a performance of over 6000 Delta V at 0.4 TWR thanks to 22 NERVA engines. Ridiculously over engineered.

"BUILD BIG OR STAY HOME"

If the Prototype mission works I will likely show a complete mission for a mission to jool with the 2nd ship.

I present to you, the KSS DesTiny (jeb named it, he liked the pun) currently in Orbit around Kerbin doing final checks and waiting for the transfer window to open to Moho
Is Moho experiencing a Sr docking ring shortage?

Nice work!

Build efficient or go home is a better saying, though!

The Red tanks with all the Docking ports are going to double as a core for Refueling stations. They can be remotely operated and can operate as craft on their own

Edited March 1, 2014 by kinnison
